reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Supporting Fixed PHCs Inside Mosul City's West Bank through provision of staff incentives .

description.narrative: In response to the expected outcomes from the continuation of Military Operations to liberate the West Bank of Mosul City, the volume of displacement is expected, to increase dramatically. More than 20 neighborhood, with an estimated 350,000 persons are controlled by ISIL, and, according to the latest OCHA situation report published, 275,000 were displaced from West Bank of Mosul City, to settle in in Qayyarah, Hammam Alalil and Hassan Sham camps, and in the East Bank of Mosul City. According to our field team visits to the southern neighborhoods of this West Bank, we noticed that some families are trying to stay in the city rather than move to the camps. Through this application of IHPF, QRCS will support 4 PHCCs (sports medicine PHCC in Gawsak district, New Mosul PHCC in New Mosul district, Nabols PHCC in Nabols district and Bab Elbeed PHCC) to enable the provision of a comprehensive package of PHC services in west bank of Mosul city . Appropriate treatment of common diseases and injuries, Provision of medical supplies and operational cost of these PHCs curative and rehabilitative services. In addition, QRCS will supplement the project with its available internal fund to ensure cluster objectives and recommendations are successfully implemented. Through our past interventions, we have developed good access in newly retaken areas of West Mosul bank and have an established, effective arrangement with Ninewa’s Department of Health. This is due to the fact that a similar project is ongoing in East Mosul (until June), supporting 9 PHCCs in cooperation with the IOM as co-funder and co-implementer. In addition, we have begun the process of re-activating Mosul General Hospital in West Mosul in coordination with the Department of Health and have received official approval to begin work in Sports Medicine PHCC (Central Lab) in Gawsak. QRCS’ procurement process takes place under full transparency, taking into consideration both quality and price in selecting medical supplies (either medications or equipment) with the technical team assigned for this process through our procurement department. In developing this proposal, QRCS has aligned interventions to health cluster recommendations as a part of Mosul contingency planning. In addition, through the supported PHCCs we can provide primary health care for returnees in newly taken areas of West
